result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Derek L. Huntington appeared by video, in custody of Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Derek L. Huntington. Atty Sebion stated the defendant has requested a substitution of Judge but prefers to proceed with Initial. Waive reading of the complaint.  Defense stood mute/entered NGP.  NGP entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.  PTC set for 5/4 @ 3pm.   and STC to be set when new Judge is assigned.
Bond Continues.
